minutes.speaker: Rohan (President)
minutes.message: Alright, let's get started. We have quite a few things to go through today. First off, any matters arising from the last meeting?

minutes.speaker: Adi (Vice President)
minutes.message: Nothing major, just following up on a few things we discussed last time.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Good. Let's move to the main updates.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: First, the library budget—£100 allocated for student welfare initiatives. We were thinking of getting a Go board.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Also, the Department of Welfare is facing budget cuts, so CUES has offered to buy some board games if the library wants them.

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: Sounds like a good idea. Who'll coordinate with the library?

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: I can handle that.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Next, elections—they should be ready today. Everyone make sure to check the details.

minutes.speaker: Kriti (Operations)
minutes.message: I'll send a reminder out later today.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Great. Lastly, I had a call with EWOR, a group of unicorn founders.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: One of them, Peter, co-founded an £8 billion startup. They're interested in hosting a webinar with CUES on the mathematics of building startups.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: The CEO is also willing to give a talk as part of their accelerator program.

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: That sounds huge! What's the timeline?

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: No exact date yet. We need to confirm the details.

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: A few things.

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: Committee work – Bank name addition takes time. We should start now.

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: Also, Rohan, since you have the card, we need to transfer access before you leave.

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: Grants – We need to sort out Easter term grants for the summer.

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: Resource changes – We'll be updating some internal resources; I'll share a draft next week.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Noted. Let's prioritize the bank transfer this week.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Budget is in good shape.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Eng Café funding: Originally, £200 per café for 5 events. We might not need to spend that much.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Negotiations? We should check if we can get cheaper/free tea if we're spending £200.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Leavers' yearbook – Estimated loss?

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Catering costs: £130 for 3L coffee, 40 half cakes.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: 5L of coffee/tea = £60 each.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Limiting by year group or time slot?

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: We should definitely ask about discounts for bulk purchases.

minutes.speaker: Kriti
minutes.message: I'll check with the café and see if we can negotiate.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Careers Fair 2025 venue issues: Kelsey Kerridge unavailable in October. Not sure why.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Student Services Centre restricting bookings—probably a continuation of last year's policy.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: This might force us into more expensive venues (Guildhall, hotels).

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Some alternative venues: Leys School, Chesterton, Uni Sports Centre, JBS?

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: Should we offer to pay the Careers Service for their venue?

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Maybe. Also, Edward mentioned a potential negotiation tactic—offering students £5-10 to boycott the University's event.

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: That's extreme but interesting. Probably more effort than it's worth, though.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Agreed. We should focus on venue alternatives first.

minutes.speaker: Kriti
minutes.message: Diversity and Access – ongoing.

minutes.speaker: Kriti
minutes.message: Welfare events: Jacks' gelato bike options: £480 for 60 guests (unlimited ice cream), £150 base + £3pp single, £4pp double, £280 min spend.

minutes.speaker: Kriti
minutes.message: Alternative location: Move to Coe Fen if courtyard is unavailable?

minutes.speaker: Kriti
minutes.message: Jacks Gelato is not responsive right now.

minutes.speaker: Kriti
minutes.message: I'll try calling them again later today.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Alright, let's move on to other opportunities.

minutes.speaker: Kriti
minutes.message: Collaborations with societies—still in the works. I'll send out another email to finalize the partnerships.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Perfect. Just make sure we have everything confirmed before the end of the month.

minutes.speaker: Kriti
minutes.message: Will do. And finally, events for the summer term—we need to start planning those.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Absolutely. Let's discuss that in the next meeting.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Alright, that's all for today's meeting. Any final thoughts or questions before we wrap up?

minutes.speaker: Adi
minutes.message: Nothing from me. Looking forward to the upcoming events!

minutes.speaker: Kriti
minutes.message: Same here. I'll keep everyone posted on updates.

minutes.speaker: Rohan
minutes.message: Great. Thanks, everyone. Meeting adjourned.
